subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text: From the removal of the two inner strokes from {{zh-l|*有|to have}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{zh-forms|alt=無,冒-Xiang}}
From {{ltc-l|無|to not have}}, fused with {{ltc-l|有|to have}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=mǎo,mǒu
|c=mou5
|c-t=mau1
|h=pfs=mò;gd=mo2
|w=3mau
|x=mau5/mau6
|x_note=mau5 - “have not; did not”; mau6 - “to not have” (contraction of {{zh-l|*冇得}})
|cat=v
}}

subSections.title: Definitions
Usage notes
subSections.text: * Originally from Cantonese, the meaning of this character is now passively understood by many Mandarin speakers.

subSections.title: Etymology 2
